article:
The Green sisters were well-known in their town because almost every week one of their names was in the local newspaper. Casey was a   _     singer. Anna was a rising star on the basketball team. Lillian was one of the best students in her school.   _  , Tina was average   so she often felt out of place among her sisters.
One evening at dinner before Christmas, Tina's mother decided to organize a(n)     _  . "Everyone is coming to   _   all your successes this year," she said to her daughters. Tina smiled, but she felt    _  . She wished she had something worth praising.
"We'll need a   _   for the party," Tina's mother said. "The girls love strawberries, so we should have a strawberry cake."
"I could42 _ a strawberry cake," said Tina. She had ever tried to bake cookies but   _   .
"That's a pretty   _   job. I don't know   _   you could do it well," Tina's mother asked.
"I can do it," Tina said  _  , but she was a little bit worried.
Tina's mother   _   to let her bake the cake.
On the day of the party, Tina woke up early and got started on the cake. Soon the   _   began to arrive at the party. When it was time for dessert, Tina's mother   _   the cake on the table. Everyone immediately commented how   _  the cake looked.
"Tina made it," said Tina's mother. A few people looked  _  for they had heard nothing great about Tina. However, one bite was all it took for people to   _    that the cake tasted as good as it looked.
"Tina, this cake is wonderful," said Aunt Maureen. "You could   _   a baking contest with this cake." Tina smiled. She wasn't used to getting so much     _   . It felt good. She found she   _    could do something really well.
